News

Libraries across Suffolk promise exciting events for big library service celebration

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 27, 2019

Many of our libraries have released initial details of the events and activities they plan to hold on and around the first ever Suffolk Libraries Day on Saturday 12 October.

Home Library Service volunteer thanked for over three decades of help

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 27, 2019

Broomhill Library volunteer Monica Ford recently retired after 32 years of delivering library books to people in their homes. Manager David Cook and volunteer engagement manager Diane Moore presented her with a card and flowers on behalf of Suffolk Libraries to thank her all she has done for us over the years.

Suffolk children's literacy gets a boost with an increase in Summer Reading Challenge figures

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 22, 2019

Suffolk Libraries' latest statistics have revealed that the number of children taking part in the Summer Reading Challenge this year has surpassed last year's total.

Gainsborough Community Library to celebrate ten-year anniversary

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 22, 2019

Monday 16 September marks ten years since Gainsborough Community Library moved into its current building. Everyone is invited to attend its birthday celebration, featuring activities for all ages, on Saturday 14 September.

East Anglian artists develop their creative practice at Hadleigh Library BLOC Lab

Written by Jenny Patch · Published Aug 19, 2019

Last week (12-16 August), Hadleigh Library hosted their very first BLOC Lab, with five East Anglian artists from different disciplines creating and working alongside each other in a library space.

Lowestoft Library registers youngest new borrower

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 16, 2019

When new mum and schoolteacher Lucy Gildroy took her newborn daughter Summer into Lowestoft Library, she did so with one goal: to sign Summer up for her very first library card.

Suffolk's favourite children's book revealed!

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 6, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has announced the top ten favourite children’s books in Suffolk, as voted for by the county’s library users.

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for September

Written by Alice Violett · Published Aug 6, 2019

This month Lesley will be discussing The Horseman, by Tim Pears.

New video streaming service available through Suffolk Libraries

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 6, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has expanded its eLibrary service with a new digital streaming platform, Kanopy.

Keep fit and explore east Suffolk with the Three Library Challenge

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 2, 2019

Three libraries are raising funds by challenging people to walk or cycle between their sites.
